text.content:
Prerequisite: Dexterity 13 or higher

Your exceptional readiness and nimble nature grant you advantages magnified by your eager and brisk approach.

Options:

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.lHsNvDfX4g8Mjy48]{Adaptive Assault}

    When you deal damage with a weapon attack that benefits from the Deft weapon property, you may deal additional damage of the weapon's type equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.9GDomDYSpAnug042]{Brisk Combat}

    When a hostile creature within reach of your melee attacks or Unarmed Strike is reduced to 0 hit points, you can take a Reaction to move up to half your Speed and make an additional melee attack or Unarmed Strike against a different creature within range.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.cNZaYA2xY6AzSnGB]{Cavort}

    You do not require a running start to jump max distances or height. Furthermore, taking fall damage does not knock you &Reference[Prone apply=false], unless you wish it to.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.jZsx5vkfAGRYeW7J]{Close the Gap}

    If you hold your Attack action, you can move up to your Speed as part of the Reaction.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.RkCs6eyp95R07kGk]{Dervish}

    When you gain Temporary Hit Points, you can increase the amount gained by your Dexterity modifier.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.XgyoMFdWJPTuUKT2]{Dexterous Adaptability}

    If you do not take the Attack action on your turn, you can use your Bonus Action to make one weapon attack or Unarmed Strike on that same turn. You cannot make this attack with a weapon that has the Heavy property.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.4LtlKh00oGIzwn57]{Enhanced Balance}

    You can move through a hostile creature's space only if the creature is at least one size larger. Additionally, moving through a hostile creature's space is not &Reference[Difficult Terrain] for you.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.jJ3yPPjYbTGYZ5m0]{Fleet}

    Your Speed increases by 10 feet.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.MKPxIZEM3hwv8Ezx]{Graceful Guile}

    When you take the Dodge action, you can move a number of feet equal to five times your Proficiency Bonus.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.a8gHutCmFOrjp0k9]{Light Footed}

    &Reference[Difficult Terrain] does not cost you extra movement.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.jpXM64vbR0MZHZyu]{Nimble}

    Standing up from &Reference[Prone apply=false] uses only 5 feet of your movement. You gain a Climb Speed equal to your Speed. You can make a running long or high jump after moving only 5 feet on foot, rather than 10 feet.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.pIcJVa9HHdpEkSk7]{Parkour}

    You can use your Dexterity in place of Strength with Climbing and Jumping, and you can fall 5 times your Proficiency Bonus feet before taking any fall damage.

You have studied the use of armor, and have improved your ability to use armor effectively.

Options:

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.WZU13w30mDg0INqM]{Armor Mastery}

    While you are wielding a shield or tower shield, or wearing Medium armor or Heavy armor you are proficient in, Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage that you take is reduced by your Proficiency Bonus.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.VRe74oOdqpUd7Yt9]{Armor Mobility}

    While wearing Light armor or Medium armor that does not impose Disadvantage on your Stealth checks, Opportunity Attacks are made against you with Disadvantage.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.IuChtc8R9y9Ur7PM]{Armored Agility}

    When you wear Medium armor you are proficient in, you can add 3, rather than 2, to your AC if you have a Dexterity of 16 or higher.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.oXJJcSe2UJT9GhzS]{Armored Stealth}

    Wearing Medium or Heavy armor which you are proficient in does not impose Disadvantage on your Stealth checks.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.tw8qsoChAnAj6baA]{Heavy Armor Mobility}

    You may ignore the minimum Strength requirement of Heavy armor you are proficient in.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.hryFf8tIZWL2GCdV]{Heavy Armor Momentum}

    While you are wearing Heavy Armor you can use your Strength modifier in place of your Dexterity modifier for your Initiative rolls. If your Dexterity modifier is negative than you must include the negative amount to your Initiative.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.4zvKPC0EuBRWBY6d]{Heavy Armor Proficiency}

    You gain proficiency in Heavy armor (you must be proficient in Medium armor from a source other than this feat to choose this bullet).

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.pEXnXsVO5OUzyqBH]{Light Armor Defense}

    While wearing Light armor, you may add your armor's AC bonus to your Dexterity saving throws. For example, if you are wearing Leather Armor you can add 1 to your Dexterity saving throws.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Lt3b1Nuox7YtOfUz]{Light Armor Mastery}

    While wearing Light armor which you are proficient in, and you are damaged by a melee attack, you can take a Reaction to move 5 feet in any direction without provoking an Opportunity Attack.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.5QrC8sgH0AKzgMvW]{Light Armor Proficiency}

    You gain proficiency in Light armor.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.fWzhiVwNT4hBRXGw]{Light Armor Versatility*}

    You may wear a Hauberk armor, Hide armor, or Mail Shirt as Light armor for the sake of determining proficiency. When wearing a Hauberk armor, Hide armor, or Mail Shirt, you can add 3, rather than 2, to your AC if you have a Dexterity of 16 or higher.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.tMCZjlUmXhKHlu0z]{Medium Armor Adaptability}

    When you wear Medium armor you are proficient in, you can use your Constitution rather than your Dexterity for the additional armor normally provided by Dexterity.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.NG7rCQSmN3ZxbFEr]{Medium Armor Proficiency}

    You gain proficiency in Medium armor (you must be proficient in Light armor through a source other than this feat to choose this bullet).

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.gNXKX33CuKC08kDl]{Shield Proficiency}

    You gain proficiency with Shields (includes bucklers, shields, and tower shields).

Prerequisite: Ability to cast at least one spell or an ability that takes a Magic action

Your magic has been honed to use in combat, your quick thinking and specialized training provide certain advantages while fighting with spells.

Options:

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.XlDS5IvS3xz4Y3uP]{Battlecaster}

    When a hostile creature's movement provokes an Opportunity Attack from you, you can take a Reaction to perform a Magic action directed at the creature, rather than making an Opportunity Attack. This action must target that creature and only that creature.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.1LWhDaPD6YG5tqEj]{Elemental Adept - Acid}

    Any spells you cast or Magic actions you take ignore Resistance to Acid damage. Creatures with Immunity to Acid damage may be damaged if they had Resistance instead.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.LSxWV4rvIssJWuXf]{Elemental Adept - Cold}

    Any spells you cast or Magic actions you take ignore Resistance to Cold damage. Creatures with Immunity to Cold damage may be damaged if they had Resistance instead.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.34m4Iz9vLZ8HrEC4]{Elemental Adept - Fire}

    Any spells you cast or Magic actions you take ignore Resistance to Fire damage. Creatures with Immunity to Fire damage may be damaged if they had Resistance instead.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.cttBhuVhld8ItZAo]{Elemental Adept - Lightning}

    Any spells you cast or Magic actions you take ignore Resistance to Lightning damage. Creatures with Immunity to Lightning damage may be damaged if they had Resistance instead.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.3OGQYAhlzGTbdwli]{Elemental Adept - Poison}

    Any spells you cast or Magic actions you take ignore Resistance to Poison damage. Creatures with Immunity to Poison damage may be damaged if they had Resistance instead.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.81N46hup2Ao21qbQ]{Elemental Adept - Thunder}

    Any spells you cast or Magic actions you take Resistance to Thunder damage. Creatures with Immunity to Thunder damage may be damaged if they had Resistance instead.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.dJ2yW5rN0bT0lC6M]{Hardy Concentration}

    You have Advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your Concentration on a spell when you take damage.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.inOKYUG3pnxtBuja]{Metamagic Adept*}

    You learn one Metamagic option of your choice from the Sorcerer class. You can use this Metamagic option on any spell you can cast of a level equal to your Proficiency Bonus or lower. You regain the expended Metamagic when you finish a Long Rest. Whenever you gain a level, you can replace one of these Metamagic options with another one from the Sorcerer class.

    Metamagic Options:

    @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.class-and-subclass-features.Item.FsMmSbEikHSUbA7D]{Careful Spell}

    @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.class-and-subclass-features.Item.38ojFqFN2zn8CCyl]{Distant Spell}

    @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.class-and-subclass-features.Item.4zMkUfBtWP7ICfnd]{Empowered Spell}

    @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.class-and-subclass-features.Item.DaIkVbEqeJ6dH9Fa]{Extended Spell}

    @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.class-and-subclass-features.Item.GUSUemdZc7WywBkH]{Heightened Spell}

    @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.class-and-subclass-features.Item.dfpJ0Onw60p2cHAa]{Quickened Spell}

    @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.class-and-subclass-features.Item.mA3OC2T3OgPqk1KE]{Seeking Spell}

    @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.class-and-subclass-features.Item.qJHNmUFBetY0dgGm]{Subtle Spell}

    @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.class-and-subclass-features.Item.AD3xVD6xLOSsq5TH]{Transmuted Spell}

    @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.class-and-subclass-features.Item.y9tN4fS4269Dedav]{Twinned Spell}

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.zVaMOt8qLFOujLt9]{Mystical Overload}

    On your turn, before you make a melee spell attack or ranged spell attack, you can choose to forgo your Proficiency Bonus to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add twice your Proficiency Bonus to the damage.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.lZQvahTSCRPmqk2p]{Mystical Overload 2}

    On your turn, before you make a melee spell attack or ranged spell attack, you may choose to forgo any amount up to your Proficiency Bonus to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add twice the amount of the penalty to the damage.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.kncPA2BcD9fWEgjd]{Punishing Magic}

    When you deal a Critical Hit with a spell attack or a creature rolls a 1 on a Saving Throw against a spell you cast and takes damage, gain a Heroic Inspiration. The spell must be cast using a spell slot.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.a6RUMI4iRRfFiCyt]{Reliable Spells}

    When you roll damage or healing for a spell you cast or Magic action you take, you can treat any 1 on a damage die or healing die as a 2.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.W8n73I2NRiilnxgM]{Reliable Spells 2}

    When you roll damage or healing for a spell you cast or Magic action you take, you can treat any 1 on a damage die or healing die as the maximum result on the die instead.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.N5RghhMHDqMgGGrb]{Salvage Spells}

    When you use the Ready action with a spell, if the trigger does not occur, your spell slot and any material components are not consumed.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.rbeTIEhYJMV5lfJX]{Spell Accuracy}

    Your melee spell attacks and ranged spell attacks ignore &Reference[Half Cover] and &Reference[Three-Quarters Cover]. Additionally, being within 5 feet of a hostile creature does not impose Disadvantage on your ranged spell attack rolls.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.GCHIcisQn85LVlS4]{Spell Sniper}

    When you cast a spell that requires you to make an attack roll, the spell's range is doubled. If the spell's attack range is at least 10 feet, then the minimum new range is 30 feet.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.BvBu8AwKVpA4xR9y]{Warcaster}

    You can perform the Somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a buckler, shield or tower shield in one or both hands.

Prerequisite: Dexterity 13 or higher

You are especially quick and nimble, and this provides you with benefits in your movement and reactions.

Options:

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.8cNu8v8UEcsVTO6t]{Combat Mobility}

    You may take the &Reference[Disengage] action as a Bonus Action.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.z5gTktsRXbiwv0tT]{Combat Mobility 2}

    Your movement does not provoke Opportunity Attacks from creatures you are aware of.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Gfzti93JOrEL2Bj8]{Escape Artist}

    You can attempt to escape a grapple as a Bonus Action. Additionally, anytime the creature that has you grappled takes damage, you can use take a Reaction to attempt to escape a grapple.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.3niuJzh3pXBoZnmR]{Fast Reflexes}

    You gain a bonus to Initiative equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.k2JUz3JXhrRmtVyZ]{Flow of Combat}

    When you miss with an Opportunity Attack made with an attack you are proficient with or Unarmed Strike, you do not use your Reaction.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.PY3ZWbDjNaQoFXlH]{Initiative Swap}

    Immediately after you roll Initiative, you can swap your Initiative with the Initiative of one willing ally in the same combat. You can't make this swap if you or the ally has the Incapacitated condition.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Ov7Jr5wMjMGcfRvJ]{Instinctive Attack}

    You can make an Opportunity Attack without having to see a hostile creature.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.ZVbcmQXM4cwYbeXv]{Keen Awareness}

    While you have &Reference[Cover], ranged attacks made against you are done at Disadvantage while you have a Speed greater than 0 and do not have the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.vp4CigD2dFdETpsl]{Reflexive}

    When take the &Reference[Dodge] action on your turn, you can make one weapon attack or Unarmed Strike as part of the same action.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.p9vXBJAtkdqMF0Qu]{Sudden Pains}

    If you are adding additional dice to a damage roll (such as after scoring a Critical Hit or a sneak attack) from an attack with a weapon with the Finesse property, you can reroll a number of dice up to your Proficiency Bonus and take the higher result.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.iKf2cfW1ZOwnTXV1]{Uncanny Dodge}

    When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can take a Reaction to expend one of your Hit Dice to halve the attack's damage against you as long as you are not wearing Heavy armor.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.zW5UMvOaTBwFKFL7]{Uncanny Senses}

    Other creatures do not gain Advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being unseen by you.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.GQqNTveZz3VB0hni]{Unerring}

    The first attack roll you make with Advantage on your turn that you are proficient in, you add your Proficiency Bonus to the attack roll again.

You have manifested some of the power of the awe inspiring and frightening dragons, granting you a broad array of potential benefits.

Options:

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.ZsHifmwB0k7rWH93]{Blood of Origination}

    When you are Bloodied and regain Hit Points from a level 1+ spell, or by expending Hit Dice, you regain additional Hit Points equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.YFAP2fIG6zNxba4Q]{Chromatic Infusion}

    As a Bonus Action, you can touch a simple, martial, or natural weapon and infuse it with one of the following damage types: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison. For the next minute, the weapon or Unarmed Strike deals an extra 1d4 damage of the chosen type when it hits. After you use this Bonus Action, you cannot do so again until you finish a Long Rest or expend one Hit Die to recharge this feature (no action required).

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.vtGA5KoYTdWd2pFK]{Elohian Wrath}

    Once on each of your turns, when you use your Weapon Mastery on a creature, you can deal Force damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.gvddG9HaoHvTxJcF]{Expanded Senses}

    The ranges of your special senses, such as Darkvision, Truesight, the ability to sense magic through the Detect Magic spell, a Paladin's Divine Sense, and other similar effects are increased by 30 feet. If any of your special senses has a range of less than 30 feet, its range is doubled instead.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.ywloVmU3iq6SgxiJ]{Great Luster}

    When a creature uses their Heroic Inspiration and you do not have one, gain a Heroic Inspiration. Once you this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.JJY3YeT4ymw3nzVU]{Protective Manifestation}

    You can manifest protective energy that can shield you or others. When you or another creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can take a Reaction to manifest spectral energy for a moment. You grant a bonus to the target's AC equal to your Proficiency Bonus against that attack roll, potentially causing it to miss. You can do this a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.ot8NivmcZdXiPpfQ]{Reactive Resistance}

    When you take Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison damage, you can take a Reaction to give yourself Resistance to that instance of damage. You can do this a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.0LPjB6FdsYC8b3pQ]{Sundering Roar}

    Once on your turn, when you score a Critical Hit or reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points, you can immediately let out a powerful roar. A number of creatures of your choice equal to your Proficiency Bonus within 30 feet of you that can hear you take Force damage equal to twice your Proficiency Bonus. Each creature can only take damage from any Sundering Roar once per turn.

You are a master of fighting with two weapons at once. Your specialized training has provided you with certain advantages when employing two weapon fighting.

Options:

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.g2brjkWx3UV9dgRW]{Bonus Attacks}

    You may use your Bonus Action to make an attack with a weapon you are holding on your turn as long as you made a weapon attack with a different weapon you are holding, even if you did not take the Attack action.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.YLV8Tw6IjMqIwpmn]{Defensive Dual Wielder}

    You gain a +1 bonus to AC while you are wielding a separate melee weapon in each hand.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.MnVO4Ul7bxeyDMFP]{Dual Weapon Versatility}

    You gain proficiency in three one handed weapons of your choice.

    Once per turn when you make an attack with a one-handed weapon while you are wielding a separate melee weapon in each hand you can apply the &Reference[Graze] Weapon Mastery property for that attack in place of the weapon's normal Weapon Mastery property.

    Foundry Note

    Upon selecting this fea, you will have to manually grant yourself proficiency with the selected weapons on your character sheet. It is recommended that you edit this feat with the weapons you selected for your own reference.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.M7PACPCjLAPKfCV5]{Flurry}

    When you make an Opportunity Attack with a weapon you are holding, you can make another weapon attack with a separate weapon you are holding as part of the same Opportunity Attack against the same target.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.i9fVOVtIBD41eQpz]{Flurry 2}

    When you make an Opportunity Attack with a weapon you are holding, you can make another weapon attack with a separate weapon you are holding as part of the same Opportunity Attack against any target within the weapon's reach.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.aSCOjTpr3Sn7JAkq]{Gauche}

    When you take the Attack action on your turn and are wielding separate melee weapons in each hand, you can declare that all of your attacks on your turn will be against a single target. For all of the attacks that hit, you can total all of the damage and hit the target all at once rather than once per attack.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.QDCRK0c8C6fe7N9U]{Heavy Dual Wielder}

    When you take the Attack action on your turn and attack with a weapon that has the Light property, you can make one extra attack as a Bonus Action later on the same turn with a different weapon, which must be a Melee weapon that lacks the Two-Handed property. You don't add your ability modifier to the extra attack's damage unless that modifier is negative.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.ChMTZ78IvQPAn1RP]{Mirrored Assault}

    While you are wielding a separate weapon in each hand, you treat both weapons as having the Finesse property as long as one of the weapons has the Finesse property.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.YaJIQXFdWvKChadr]{Multi Attacker}

    When you use a Bonus Action to attack using two-weapon fighting, you may make an additional attack with that weapon if you made more than one attack with another weapon you are holding on that turn.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.vHEhx9zZIswKQ8Jq]{Paired Weapons}

    When you miss a melee weapon attack while you are wielding a separate melee weapon in each hand, you can immediately take a Reaction to make a melee weapon attack with the opposite weapon you are holding.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.vB63AVPt2vNbGBj2]{Quick Dual Wielding}

    You can draw or stow two weapons that lack the Two-Handed property when you would normally be able to draw or stow only one.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.BS8p1lSUKOJ00buS]{Quick Dual Wielding 2}

    When you take the &Reference[Attack] action, you can equip two one-handed weapons as part of that action rather than just one. You may also unequip a one-handed weapon as part of this action.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.tn1mRStwwa8BF1Li]{Relentlessness}

    When you succeed on an ability check or saving throw to avoid or end a Condition on yourself, you can make one weapon attack with one of the weapons you are holding if you are wielding a separate weapon in each hand. The weapon attack must be made against a target within range of your weapon.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.MXI8o30Rx8b8ZopZ]{Twisting Strikes}

    On your turn, when you score a Critical Hit or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a one-handed weapon while you are wielding a separate weapon in each hand, your next attack with the opposite weapon is made with Advantage.

Feats

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaAlacrity00]{Alacrity} (@UUID[.matJrnFeaAlacrit]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaArmorSpeci]{Armor Specialist} (@UUID[.matJrnFeaArmorSp]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaBattleMagi]{Battle Magic} (@UUID[.matJrnFeaBattleM]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaBravura000]{Bravura} (@UUID[.matJrnFeaBravura]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaCombatRefl]{Combat Reflexes} (@UUID[.matJrnFeaCombatR]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaDualWeapon]{Dual Weapon Specialist} (@UUID[.matJrnFeaDualWea]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaElohian000]{Elohian} (@UUID[.matJrnFeaElohian]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaMagicalTra]{Magical Training} (@UUID[.matJrnFeaMagicTr]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaMountedCom]{Mounted Combat Specialist} (@UUID[.matJrnFeaMounted]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaNaturalWea]{Natural Weapon Specialist} (@UUID[.matJrnFeaNatWeap]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaPracticedC]{Practiced Combatant} (@UUID[.matJrnFeaPractic]{description and bullet options})

You have learned the basics of magic, either through a teacher, or on your own initiative. This has given you rudimentary magic skills and/or the training to deal with spellcasters.

Options:

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.jPKkOxQ7HxippXdy]{Cantrip Adept*}

    Any cantrip with a casting time of 1 action that does not make an attack roll, use attacks as part of the spell's effect, or impose a saving throw can be cast as a Bonus Action instead.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.6J9E4Tw9pK1Kj67I]{Eldritch Adept*}

    You learn one non-Pact Eldritch Invocation option of your choice from the Warlock class. If the invocation has a prerequisite of any kind, you can choose that invocation only if you are a Warlock who meets the prerequisite. Whenever you gain a level, you can replace the invocation with another one from the Warlock class.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.PfMeTbfbDcA0YY8E]{Hedge Magic*}

    Choose 2 cantrips from any one spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose when you select this feat). You may select this bullet more than once.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.wVfHkL9epY8MfTQb]{Mage Slayer}

    When a creature within reach of a melee weapon you are holding or your Unarmed Strike casts a spell or takes a Magic action, you can take a Reaction to make a melee attack with the same weapon you are holding or your Unarmed Strike against that creature.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.2QWgJ353K1Xck2G9]{Mage Slayer 2}

    When a creature within reach of a melee weapon you are holding or your Unarmed Strike casts a spell or takes a Magic action, you can use take a Reaction to make a melee attack with the same weapon you are holding or your Unarmed Strike against that creature. If the attack hits, the target loses the spell.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.8ggtMBQTiKYL6MbS]{Magical Adept}

    Choose a Level 1 spell from any spell list. You learn that spell and always it prepared. You can cast it at its lowest level without using a spell slot. Once you cast it in this way, you cannot cast it in this way again until you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast this spell using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Whenever you gain a new level, you can replace the spell you chose for this feat with a different Level 1 spell from the chosen spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose when you select this feat). You may select this bullet more than once.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.M3bR7Lgk2PuBt0sB]{Magical Adroitness}

    You are able to maintain cantrips that normally require Concentration without the need to maintain Concentration. You can have a number of these cantrip effects active at any one given time equal to your Proficiency Bonus (minimum of 1).

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Y5diR32TdbwLRNEA]{Magical Implement*}

    You gain proficiency with one type of Artisan's Tools of your choice, and you can use that type of tool as a spellcasting focus for any spell you cast.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.kU13ZqTqHsfrxj3F]{Magical Parry}

    When you are targeted by an attack from a Magic action or spell, you can take a Reaction to add your Proficiency Bonus to your AC for that attack, potentially causing the attack to miss you.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.VIXhjjHO68UWgkZY]{Quick Ritual}

    You can cast a Ritual spell that you have prepared using its regular casting time rather than the extended time for a Ritual. Doing so doesn't require a spell slot. Once you cast the spell in this way, you can't use this benefit again until you finish a Long Rest.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.cuglRuHdRjtFRu0k]{Rapid Ritual}

    When you cast a spell with a duration of Instantaneous as a Ritual, the extra duration for casting as a Ritual is reduced to one minute.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.cP1NR2b1Ywa26MHb]{Ritual Adept}

    When you cast a spell as a Ritual, you are not required to maintain Concentration during the casting.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.eoUDU8zNMhHIipZd]{Ritual Caster 2*}

    You may select a level 2 spell with the Ritual tag from the same class as your @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.IlP8kzBtI5JLSjEC]{Ritual Caster} feat that you may cast as a Ritual.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.IlP8kzBtI5JLSjEC]{Ritual Caster*}

    Choose two level 1 spells equal that have the Ritual tag. You always have those spells prepared, and you can cast them with any spell slots you have. The spells' spellcasting ability is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this bullet).

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.AvDnSACW5Xf6gHpv]{Snap Preparation}

    Once per day when you finish a Short Rest you can change up to a number of your prepared spells equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.QoCnmfrfioXyWIZ0]{Spell Interruption}

    When you damage a creature that is Concentrating, that creature has Disadvantage on the saving throw it makes to maintain its Concentration.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Rxh3FP4xAAt8TcPN]{Universal Spell Focus}

    If you have the Spellcasting Focus feature from a class you have levels in, that spellcasting focus becomes an applicable focus for all spells from any class and its bonuses, if any, are shared.

You are a master of fighting while mounted. Your specialized training has provided you with certain advantages when fighting on horseback or another applicable mount.

Options:

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.8hhC2smeNrucguBt]{Cavalry Attack}

    You have Advantage on melee attack rolls against any unmounted creature that is smaller than your mount.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.fUp2TNIK47Wt1E1Q]{Cavalry Attack 2}

    You have Advantage on melee attack rolls against any unmounted creature that is equal size or smaller than your mount.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.vYbgrVL37mRbo66f]{Durable Mount}

    If your mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It may use your saving throw modifier if it is higher.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.H8ELV3rr7hpPsdXH]{Durable Mount 2}

    If your mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity or Constitution saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It may use your saving throw modifier if it is higher.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.9XSImATEXKrmSviI]{Lance Charge}

    If your mount moves at least 10 feet towards an enemy on your turn and you use the &Reference[Attack] action to attack that enemy with a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.items.Item.matIteLance00000]{Lance}, you can choose to forgo your Proficiency Bonus to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add twice your Proficiency Bonus to the damage. If you hit with your initial attack and have the Extra Attack feature, you may forgo your second attack and the hit is considered a Critical Hit and the enemy is knocked &Reference[Prone] if they are no larger than your mount.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.C7fdX21nmd3PqhEE]{Mount Defender}

    You can force an attack targeted at your mount to target you instead.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.SpClwQAn6gQ85s7T]{Mount Defender 2}

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.EvmosSw3RcZhMhGy]{Mounted Combat Mastery}

    If your mount is controlled, it is not restricted in the actions you can have it make. (normally a controlled mount is restricted to the Dodge, Dash or Disengage actions).

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.x2c3xyemYIT3IFRa]{Mounted Combat Mastery 2}

    You may control a mount even if it is not trained for combat

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Y848D4j8ZYtJkLAP]{Weapon Versatility*}

    You gain proficiency in the Lance, and two other martial weapons of your choice.

Prerequisite: A species that has a feature that provides them with Natural Weapons.

Special: When you reach character level 6, if you have taken two or more bullets from this feat, your Natural Weapon attacks can deal your choice of Force damage or its normal damage type.

You are a master of fighting with the weapons nature has provided you. You've honed your anatomy to provide you with certain advantages when fighting with your natural weapons.

Options:

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.zBOkOtwJyQkZEsri]{Born to Hunt}

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.9Ybp8zyliI1k3jcV]{Born to Hunt 2}

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.DyN7iltN5xxfsnxo]{Dire Fixation 2*}

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.zmIBUgZmOQupNHI6]{Dire Fixation*}

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.iOxKQjZCabrSmYR8]{Natural Fury*}

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.D3TT9NWvEjYHBbV3]{Natural Weapon Mastery}

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.KxvIAo2ccoBkkvkY]{Primal Onslaught}

    When you use a Bonus Action to attack using your Natural Weapon, you may make an additional attack with your Natural Weapon if you made more than one attack with your Natural Weapon on your turn.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.E05ZfAb3mxQOHavo]{Supernatural}

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.JBB3sK1pfsUkdVpb]{Wild Momentum}

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.OC94gfdmcPMlyk0C]{Wild Momentum 2}

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.aFyEzQxCXfPSEEpP]{Deep Cuts}

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.yP77mxUl9j74xawY]{Executioner}

    When you score a Critical Hit that deals Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage to a creature, you can roll one additional damage die and add your attacking stats modifier an additional time when determining the extra damage the target takes.

Once applied, this poison retains its potency for 1 minute or until you deal damage with the poisoned item, whichever is shorter. When a creature takes damage from the poisoned item, that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus your Proficiency Bonus plus the ability modifier used) or take a number of d4s equal to your Proficiency Bonus as Poison damage and become &Reference[Poisoned] until the end of your next turn.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.9UOYJgJ2VshHsINn]{Mortal Reminder}

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.iqgR2nlJk8azzNsG]{Poisoner}

Your Dungeon Master may allow you to forgo one of your feature selections from any given feat to instead replace it with one that matches your character's species. However, these Species Feat options cannot be part of a Half-Feat.

Multiple Bullet Species Feats

Some Species Feats either require you to forgo multiple feat bullets or give you the option to take the Species feat multiple times. In either case, you will be required to spread these species feat bullets across two different parents feats.

For example, you are playing a Halfling and at 4th level you take the parent feat @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaArmorSpeci]{Armor Specialist}. You select any two bullets from Armor Specialist but then substitute your third selection with the species feat Bountiful Luck. This is the first time you have selected Bountiful Luck as a feat selection, and you would gain no benefit at this time because it specifically requires ou to forgo two of your feat bullets.

Now the same Halfling reaches 8th level and takes the parent feat @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaSkillSpeci]{Educated}. You may take any two bullets from the Educated but then substitute the third selection with the species feat Bountiful Luck. Now this is the second time you have selected Bountiful Luck as a feat selection, and you gain the benefit of the species feat.

When you use this ability, you cannot use your Lucky species trait before the end of your next turn.

You are required to forgo two of your feat bullets to select Bountiful Luck.

A target automatically succeeds on the save if it can't hear or see you. On a failed save, a target becomes frightened of you for 1 minute. If the frightened target takes any damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.
